org.cip4.elk.alces.transport
Class HttpDispatcher

java.lang.Object
  org.cip4.elk.alces.transport.HttpDispatcher

public class HttpDispatcher
extends java.lang.Object

A service for sending messages over HTTP.

Version:
$Id$
Author:
Claes Buckwalter (clabu@itn.liu.se)

Constructor Summary
HttpDispatcher()
          Creates a new single-threaded dispatcher for sending HTTP requests.
HttpDispatcher(int maxConnections, int maxConnectionsPerHost)
          Creates a new multi-threaded dispatcher for sending HTTP requests.

          Creates a new single-threaded dispatcher for sending HTTP requests.

          Creates a new multi-threaded dispatcher for sending HTTP requests.

Constructor Detail

HttpDispatcher

public HttpDispatcher()
Creates a new single-threaded dispatcher for sending HTTP requests.

HttpDispatcher

public HttpDispatcher(int maxConnections,
                      int maxConnectionsPerHost)
Creates a new multi-threaded dispatcher for sending HTTP requests.

Parameters:
maxConnections - the maximum number of concurrent connections; if -1 then the dispatcher will not be multi-threaded
maxConnectionsPerHost - the maximum number of concurrent connections per host; ignored if connectionPoolSize is -1

HttpDispatcher

public HttpDispatcher(java.lang.String proxyHost,
                      int proxyPort,
                      java.lang.String proxyUser,
                      java.lang.String proxyPassword)
Creates a new single-threaded dispatcher for sending HTTP requests.

Parameters:
proxyHost - the proxy's address; null if no proxy is used
proxyPort - the proxy's port; -1 if no proxy is used
proxyUser - username for proxy authentication; null if authentication is not used
proxyPassword - password for proxy authentication; null if authentication is not used

HttpDispatcher

public HttpDispatcher(java.lang.String proxyHost,
                      int proxyPort,
                      java.lang.String proxyUser,
                      java.lang.String proxyPassword,
                      int maxConnections,
                      int maxConnectionsPerHost)
Creates a new multi-threaded dispatcher for sending HTTP requests.

Parameters:
proxyHost - the proxy's address; null if no proxy is used
proxyPort - the proxy's port; -1 if no proxy is used
proxyUser - username for proxy authentication; null if authentication is not used
proxyPassword - password for proxy authentication; null if authentication is not used
maxConnections - the maximum number of concurrent connections; if -1 then the dispatcher will not be multi-threaded
maxConnectionsPerHost - the maximum number of concurrent connections per host; ignored if connectionPoolSize is -1
Method Detail

dispatch

public InMessage dispatch(Message message,
                          java.lang.String url)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Posts a Message to a URL.

Parameters:
message - the message to post
url - the URL to post to
Returns:
the response to the posted message
Throws:
java.io.IOException
org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpException
